entries.meaning: (Britain, Canada, New Zealand, military slang) Relating to reconnaissance.
examples: There appears a captured photograph showing cruiser or battleship recovery of an old Jap float recce plane.

entries.meaning: (Britain, Canada, New Zealand, military slang) Reconnaissance.
examples: Visiting the town on what in the more recent war we called a recce, she arranged a tennis-match with Dolly, guessing that the girl would be a bad loser.

verbs.description: recce (third-person singular simple present recces, present participle recceing, simple past and past participle recced or recce'd or recceed)

entries.meaning: (Britain, Canada, New Zealand, military slang) Reconnoitre.
examples: I told the boys to stock up with all they could, and went back to the village to recce for someone to pay as per orders.
